meanings.definition: A continuous pain in a part of the body.
meanings.sent1: Her headache turned into a persistent ache in her temples.
meanings.sent2: The ache in his back made it hard for him to sit for long periods.
meanings.sent3: The ache in her muscles after exercise was a sign of a good workout.
meanings.sent4: The ache in his heart from missing his family was unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The dull ache in her tooth kept her up all night.

meanings.definition: To suffer from a dull pain.
meanings.sent1: She would ache all over after a long day of hiking.
meanings.sent2: His joints ache whenever it's about to rain.
meanings.sent3: He would ache for days after lifting heavy boxes during the move.
meanings.sent4: Her heart would ache every time she thought of her lost pet.
meanings.sent5: The old wound would ache whenever it was going to snow.

meanings.definition: To have or suffer a continuous pain.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, his leg would ache constantly.
meanings.sent2: She would ache from the cold wind blowing through the window.
meanings.sent3: His heart would ache whenever he saw her with someone else.
meanings.sent4: The ache in her joints reminded her of the long years of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The ache in his bones made him feel much older than he was.
